Using FIPA ACL

The communicating skill offers some actions and built-in variables which enable agents to communicate with each other using the FIPA interaction protocol. This document describes the built-in variables and actions of this skill. Examples are found in the models library bundled with GAMA.

##Variables

  • accept_proposals (list): A list of â€˜accept_proposalâ€™ performative messages of the agentâ€™s mailbox having .
  • agrees (list): A list of â€˜accept_proposalâ€™ performative messages.
  • cancels (list): A list of â€˜cancelâ€™ performative messages.
  • cfps (list): A list of â€˜cfpâ€™ (call for proposal) performative messages.
  • conversations (list): A list containing the current conversations of agent. Ended conversations are automatically removed from this list.
  • failures (list): A list of â€˜failureâ€™ performative messages.
  • informs (list): A list of â€˜informâ€™ performative messages.
  • messages (list): The mailbox of the agent, a list of messages of all types of performatives.
  • proposes (list): A list of â€˜proposeâ€™ performative messages .
  • queries (list): A list of â€˜queryâ€™ performative messages.
  • refuses (list): A list of â€˜proposeâ€™ performative messages.
  • reject_proposals (list): A list of â€˜reject_proposalsâ€™ performative messages.
  • requests (list): A list of â€˜requestâ€™ performative messages.
  • requestWhens (list): A list of â€˜request-whenâ€™ performative messages.
  • subscribes (list): A list of â€˜subscribeâ€™ performative messages.

Actions

####accept_proposal Replies a message with an â€˜accept_proposalâ€™ performative message

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####agree Replies a message with an â€˜agreeâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####cancel Replies a message with a â€˜cancelâ€™ peformative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####cfp Replies a message with a â€˜cfpâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####end_conversation Replies a message with an â€˜end_conversationâ€™ peprformative message. This message marks the end of a conversation. In a â€˜no-protocolâ€™ conversation, it is the responsible of the modeler to explicitly send this message to mark the end of a conversation/interaction protocol.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####failure Replies a message with a â€˜failureâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####inform Replies a message with an â€˜informâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####propose Replies a message with a â€˜proposeâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####query Replies a message with a â€˜queryâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####refuse Replies a message with a â€˜refuseâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####reject_proposal Replies a message with a â€˜reject_proposalâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####reply Replies a message. This action should be only used to reply a message in a â€˜no-protocolâ€™ conversation and with a â€˜user defined performativeâ€™. For performatives supported by GAMA (i.e., standard FIPA performatives), please use the â€˜actionâ€™ with the same name of â€˜performativeâ€™. For example, to reply a message with a â€˜requestâ€™ performative message, the modeller should use the â€˜requestâ€™ action.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • performative (string): The performative of the replying message
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####request Replies a message with a â€˜requestâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message

####send Starts a conversation/interaction protocol.

  • returns: msi.gaml.extensions.fipa.Message
  • receivers (list): A list of receiver agents
  • content (list): The content of the message. A list of any GAML type
  • performative (string): A string, representing the message performative
  • protocol (string): A string representing the name of interaction protocol

####start_conversation Starts a conversation/interaction protocol.

  • returns: msi.gaml.extensions.fipa.Message
  • receivers (list): A list of receiver agents
  • content (list): The content of the message. A list of any GAML type
  • performative (string): A string, representing the message performative
  • protocol (string): A string representing the name of interaction protocol

####subscribe Replies a message with a â€˜subscribeâ€™ performative message.

  • returns: unknown
  • message (message): The message to be replied
  • content (list): The content of the replying message
//: # (endConcept fipa_acl)
